definition: grave danger/in jeopardy/in a critical condition

sentences.english: The South China Tiger (Panthera tigris amoyensis) is in grave danger of extinction.
sentences.chinese: 中國南方老虎於絕種的危殆。

sentences.english: The man has been rushed to the Queen Mary Ho ital and is presently in critical condition.
sentences.chinese: 該名男子被送往伊莉沙伯醫院搶救，目前情況危殆。

sentences.english: The man has been rushed to the Queen Mary Hospital and is presently in critical condition.
sentences.chinese: 該名男子被送往伊莉沙伯醫院搶救，目前情況危殆。

sentences.english: All the stimulated stroke coma, critically hospital.
sentences.chinese: 全受刺激中風昏迷入院，情況危殆。

sentences.english: She was in critical condition and lost a leg, but survived.
sentences.chinese: 她在危殆情況下失去了一條腿，但她倖存了。

sentences.english: The government deluded the public about the dangers of low-level radiation.
sentences.chinese: 政府欺騙公衆，關於低強度輻射的危殆性。

sentences.english: His condition is reported as being critical.
Her body had dehydrated dangerously with the heat.
sentences.chinese: 她因受酷熱身體脫水，情況危殆。

definition: unable to turn around a hopeless situation (idiom)/to fail to save the situation
to think nothing of doing sth (idiom)/to do sth without considering the risks/to leave out of consideration
to die of illness or injury despite receiving medical help
to overturn (a vehicle)/to capsize/to turn upside down/to change completely
variant of 杌隉|杌陧[wu4 nie4]
